problem_text:
Let G be a group whose set of elements is the real numbers and which is “nicely definable” (see below). Does G being ℵω-free imply it being free if “nicely definable” means
a) being Fσ?
b) being Borel?
c) being analytic?
d) being projective L[R]?
See https://arxiv.org/pdf/math/0212250.pdf for justification of the restrictions.
S. Shelah
